Package com.qrhunter

Class PlayerDatabse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qrhunter.PlayerDatabse
  • public class PlayerDatabse
extends java.lang.Object
    A database of all Players. This also facilitates communicating with the firestore.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayerDatabse()
      constructs the databse and downloads all the data.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addClaimedID​(java.lang.String player, java.lang.String id)
      adds the ID of the claimed object to the player database under the player to show that they possess it
      void addPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName, java.lang.String playerPassword)
      adds the provided player into the firestore database (the addition updates the local database)
      void deletePlayer​(java.lang.String playerName)
      removes the provided player from the firestore database as well as the local databse.
      void deleteUser​(java.lang.String username)
      Removes a user from the database.
      boolean exists​(java.lang.String playerName)
      specifically used for testing purposes, checks if a particular player exists within the database.
      Player getPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName)
      gives a player object if the player exists within the firebase, otherwise returns null
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Player> getPlayers()
      Returns all players (NO USERS/OWNERS)
      com.qrhunter.User getUser​(java.lang.String username)  
      boolean isFinishDownloading()
      communicates with the code to check if the local database is finished downloading.
      java.lang.Boolean isPlayer​(java.lang.String username)
      Checks if a username matches a player in the database.
      void removeClaimedID​(java.lang.String player, java.lang.String id)
      Removes a collectable ID from a player in the database
      void removeCollectable​(java.lang.String id)
      Removes a collectible ID from EVERY player in the database

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerDatabse

        public PlayerDatabse()
        constructs the databse and downloads all the data.

    • Method Detail

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName,
                      java.lang.String playerPassword)
        adds the provided player into the firestore database (the addition updates the local database)
        Parameters:
        playerName - the player's username
        playerPassword - the player's password

      • deletePlayer

        public void deletePlayer​(java.lang.String playerName)
        removes the provided player from the firestore database as well as the local databse.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the deleted player's name

      • isFinishDownloading

        public boolean isFinishDownloading()
        communicates with the code to check if the local database is finished downloading. this prevents some login errors due to firebase's async nature.
        Returns:
        whether the databse is done downloading or not

      • exists

        public boolean exists​(java.lang.String playerName)
        specifically used for testing purposes, checks if a particular player exists within the database. Please use getPlayer() in your code, as it is significantly more flexible.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the username of the player
        Returns:
        whether it is present within the database

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName)
        gives a player object if the player exists within the firebase, otherwise returns null
        Parameters:
        playerName - the player's username
        Returns:
        the player or null if the player does not exist.

      • addClaimedID

        public void addClaimedID​(java.lang.String player,
                         java.lang.String id)
        adds the ID of the claimed object to the player database under the player to show that they possess it
        Parameters:
        player - The player
        id - The id of the QR Code.

      • removeClaimedID

        public void removeClaimedID​(java.lang.String player,
                            java.lang.String id)
        Removes a collectable ID from a player in the database
        Parameters:
        id - The collectable to be removed
        player - the player that has the collectable

      • getPlayers

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Player> getPlayers()
        Returns all players (NO USERS/OWNERS)
        Returns:
        HashMap of all players

      • getUser

        public com.qrhunter.User getUser​(java.lang.String username)

      • isPlayer

        public java.lang.Boolean isPlayer​(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if a username matches a player in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The user to be checked
        Returns:
        Returns true if username matches a player in the database

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Removes a user from the database.
        Parameters:
        username - The user to be deleted

      • removeCollectable

        public void removeCollectable​(java.lang.String id)
        Removes a collectible ID from EVERY player in the database
        Parameters:
        id - The collectable to be removed
